newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai sugar vessels movement slows this week.
newsitem.headline: Thai sugar vessels movement slows this week.

text.p: Sugar shipments from Thailand slowed this week due to thin physical demand and monsoon rains which hampered traffic and loading, sources said on Thursday.
About 60,000 tonnes of white and raw sugar was expected to be shipped or loaded between August 31 and September 11, mostly headed for Asian destinations, they said.

Tate & Lyle was said to have bought 25,500 tonnes of bagged white sugar to ship to Pakistan. The vessels Halldor and Arad were scheduled to leave the port with the consignment on September 3 and September 8, respectively.
Two other vessels were expected to arrive by September 5 and September 11 for the loading of 3,200 tonnes of bagged white to be shipped to Cambodia. Tate & Lyle and Kerry were said to be buyers.
The sources said Nissho Iwai and Kerry also bought 16,600 tonnes of raw sugar for shipment to Japan.
